page.title: 01FARMLAND N.E. OF ALVELEY
page.content: This is an area of gently rolling countryside consisting of many small fields interspread with deciduos coppices and impenetrable dingles through which run small tributaries of the Severn. Through the western edge of the block runs the Bridgnorth - Kidderminster road, and the Bridgnorth - Stourbridge road cuts through the extreme north-east corner. The remainder of the land is criss-crossed by lanes, bridleways and footpaths. There is mixed farming - sheep rearing, cattle fattening, cereal growing and root crops, especially sugar-beet which is processed at Kidderminster. High in the centre of the block in private parkland is the manor house, Coton Hall. There are scattered farmhouses and cottages, but the majority of the population is concentrated in the south-west corner
